DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to evaluate the safety, tolerability and effectiveness of BTA798 on - shortening the length and reducing the symptoms of human rhinovirus infection (also known as the common cold), - controlling asthma symptoms, and - lowering the risk of asthma symptoms worsening in subjects with asthma.
DOC.brief_title: A Phase 2 Study of BTA798 in Asthmatic Adults With Symptomatic Human Rhinovirus Infection
DOC.detailed_description: Subjects with a previous diagnosis of asthma will be pre screened within 90 days prior to enrolment. If a subject develops symptoms of human rhinovirus (HRV) infection they will visit the site for assessment. Symptomatic subjects meeting all eligibility criteria will be invited to enroll.
DOC.criteria: Male and female subjects aged 1870 years Diagnosis of asthma consistent with Global Initiative for Asthma (GINA) steps 1 to 3 Presumptive human rhinovirus infection Current severe asthma exacerbation Severe asthma, GINA steps 4 or higher Uncontrolled or clinically significant medical condition, disease or event which could impact subject safety and/or study evaluations and/or compliance to the protocol Current smoker, exsmoker of <1 year, or history of smoking >/=10 pack years.
